query: company looking for email marketing agency
content: Recently, I interviewed a few candidates for an Email Marketing position. And what I discovered was… surprising. Almost everyone claimed to be an email marketing expert. But when I started asking practical questions — things got quiet. ❓What is segmentation and why does it matter? ❓Which metrics do you monitor to evaluate campaign performance? ❓How do emails actually get sent and delivered? ❓What’s the difference between IP reputation and domain reputation? Most had no idea. Here’s the truth — email marketing is more technical than most people think. It’s not just about designing nice templates or hitting “send.” It’s about understanding deliverability, data, and how your system truly works behind the scenes. If you don’t know how your emails reach inboxes, you can’t fix problems or improve performance. 👉 Before calling yourself an expert, master the fundamentals — segmentation, metrics, and deliverability. That’s where real expertise begins. hashtag # digitalmarketing hashtag # email hashtag # expert hashtag # campaign

content: The other day, a new business requirement popped up in my inbox: “We need to send an automated email when a loan gets approved.” Pretty straightforward, right? Well… not really. 👀 As a Business Analyst, I’ve learned that *no requirement is ever as simple as it sounds.* So instead of noting it down, I started asking questions: * What’s the real purpose behind this email? * Who should receive it, and when exactly? * Which system will trigger it — Salesforce, workflow, or API? * What’s the key metric to define success? Each question opened a new layer of understanding — and by the end, it wasn’t just about an email anymore. It became a well-structured business process that actually added value. That’s the beauty of being a BA — we don’t just *gather* requirements, we *decode* them. content: Why I don’t write “professional” emails anymore I was sending those standard cold outreach emails — polite, formal, "professional". But they sounded like every other email you’d read. And templates don’t get replies — people get replies. Things changed when I started writing them as if I were talking to a friend. 🤝 I stopped pushing and started connecting. Now every single email I send has one goal: to make the person smile enough to care about replying. Because link building isn’t about links - it’s about relationships. When you take the time to understand who’s on the other side, when your message feels real and personal enough — real collaborations follow. ✨ So here’s my rule now: If my email doesn’t sound like me, it’s not leaving my drafts. 👇 How do you make your outreach feel more human? I’d love to hear your take. hashtag # LinkBuilding hashtag # LinkExchange hashtag # Outreach hashtag # SEO
